function.name: psPut
function.description: Put an item into the store. Returns true if the store did not contain an item with the same key, false otherwise.
function.prototype: <any T1, any T2> public stateful boolean psPut(T1 key, T2 item)

function.name: psGet
function.description: Get an item from the store. Returns true if the store did contain an item with the given key and a matching type, false otherwise.
function.prototype: <any T1, any T2> public stateful boolean psGet(T1 key, mutable T2 item)

function.name: psTypeOf
function.description: Get the type of a value from the store. Returns true if the store did contain an item with the given key, false otherwise The typeName parameter holds the type of the value associated with the key.
function.prototype: <any T1> public stateful boolean psTypeOf(T1 key, mutable rstring typeName)

function.name: psCas
function.description: Compare and swap. If 'key' does not exist, insert it with a value that is set to 'newValue'. If 'key' exists, compare the current value associated with it to 'value'. If they are the same, then replace the current value associated with 'key' with 'newValue' and return true. If they are different, copy the current value associated with 'key' into 'value' and return false. In the latter case, if the types of the current value associated with 'key' and that of 'value' do not match, then 'value' is left untouched.
function.prototype: <any T1, any T2, any T3> public stateful boolean psCas(T1 key, mutable T2 value, T3 newValue)

function.name: psRemove
function.description: Remove an item from the store. Returns true if the store did contain an item with the given key, false otherwise.
function.prototype: <any T1> public stateful boolean psRemove(T1 key)

function.name: psHas
function.description: Check if an item exists. Returns true if the store does contain an item with the given key, false otherwise.
function.prototype: <any T1> public stateful boolean psHas(T1 key)

function.name: psClear
function.description: Clear the entire store.
function.prototype: public stateful void psClear()

function.name: psSize
function.description: Get the size of the store.
function.prototype: public stateful uint64 psSize()

function.name: psSerialize
function.description: Serialize all the items in the store.
function.prototype: public stateful void psSerialize(mutable blob data)

function.name: psSerialize
function.description: Serialize the items in the store that have key and value types that match those of the arguments.
function.prototype: <any T1, any T2> public stateful void psSerialize(mutable blob data, T1 dummyKey, T2 dummyValue)

function.name: psSerialize
function.description: Serialize the items in the store that have key and value types that match those of the tuple argument. E.g., tuple<tuple<int32 key, rstring value> type1, tuple<list<int32> key, decimal32 value> type2>
function.prototype: <tuple T> public stateful void psSerialize(mutable blob data, T types)

function.name: psDeserialize
function.description: Deserialize the items from the serialized store of key and value types that match those of the arguments.
function.prototype: <any T1, any T2> public stateful void psDeserialize(blob data, T1 dummyKey, T2 dummyValue)

function.name: psDeserialize
function.description: Deserialize the items from the serialized store of key and value types that match those of the tuple argument. E.g., tuple<tuple<int32 key, rstring value> type1, tuple<list<int32> key, decimal32 value> type2>
function.prototype: <tuple T> public stateful void psDeserialize(blob data, T types)

function.name: psBeginIteration
function.description: Begin the iteration. No other operations that can modify the state can be used until after a matching endIteration() call. Returns the iterator.
function.prototype: public stateful uint64 psBeginIteration()

function.name: psGetNext
function.description: Get the next key and value of given types. Returns true if an item was found, false otherwise.
function.prototype: <any T1, any T2> public stateful boolean psGetNext(uint64 iterator, mutable T1 key, mutable T2 value)

function.name: psGetNext
function.description: Get the next key and value as well as their types. The values are returned (in out parameters) using their string representations no matter what their types are. Returns true if an item was found, false otherwise.
function.prototype: public stateful boolean psGetNext(uint64 iterator, mutable rstring key, mutable rstring value, mutable rstring keyType, mutable rstring valueType)

function.name: psEndIteration
function.description: End the iteration.
function.prototype: public stateful void psEndIteration(uint64 iterator)

function.name: psCreateStore
function.description: Create a new process store with a given name. Return the process store handle.
function.prototype: public stateful uint64 psCreateStore()

function.name: psCreateStore
function.description: Create a new process store with a given name. Return the process store handle. This version of the createStore enables one to create unsynchronized stores.
function.prototype: public stateful uint64 psCreateStore(boolean synchronized)

function.name: psCreateStore
function.description: Create a new process store with a given name. Return the process store handle if created, 0 otherwise (a process store with the same name exists).
function.prototype: public stateful uint64 psCreateStore(rstring name)

function.name: psCreateStore
function.description: Create a new process store with a given name. Return the process store handle if created, 0 otherwise (a process store with the same name exists). This version of the createStore enables one to create unsynchronized stores.
function.prototype: public stateful uint64 psCreateStore(rstring name, boolean synchronized)

function.name: psCreateOrGetStore
function.description: Create a new process store with a given name or get it if it already exists. Return the process store handle.
function.prototype: public stateful uint64 psCreateOrGetStore(rstring name)

function.name: psCreateOrGetStore
function.description: Create a new process store with a given name or get it if it already exists. Return the process store handle or 0 if the store exists but has non-matching synhronization. This version of the createStore enables one to create unsynchronized stores.
function.prototype: public stateful uint64 psCreateOrGetStore(rstring name, boolean synchronized)

function.name: psGetAllStoreInfo
function.description: Get all store information. Returns the store names and handles.
function.prototype: public stateful void psGetAllStoreInfo(mutable list<rstring> names, mutable list<uint64> handles)

function.name: psFindStore
function.description: Find a process store given its name. Return the process store handle if found, 0 otherwise.
function.prototype: public stateful uint64 psFindStore(rstring name)

function.name: psRemoveStore
function.description: Remove a process store given its handle.
function.prototype: public stateful void psRemoveStore(uint64 store)

function.name: psPut
function.description: Put an item into the given store. Returns true if the store did not contain an item with the same key, false otherwise.
function.prototype: <any T1, any T2> public stateful boolean psPut(uint64 store, T1 key, T2 item)

function.name: psTypeOf
function.description: Get the type of a value from the given store. Returns true if the store did contain an item with the given key, false otherwise The typeName parameter holds the type of the value associated with the key.
function.prototype: <any T1> public stateful boolean psTypeOf(uint64 store, T1 key, mutable rstring typeName)

function.name: psGet
function.description: Get an item from the given store. Returns true if the store did contain an item with the given key and a matching type, false otherwise.
function.prototype: <any T1, any T2> public stateful boolean psGet(uint64 store, T1 key, mutable T2 item)

function.name: psCas
function.description: Compare and swap in a given store. If 'key' does not exist, insert it with a value that is set to 'newValue'. If 'key' exists, compare the current value associated with it to 'value'. If they are the same, then replace the current value associated with 'key' with 'newValue' and return true. If they are different, copy the current value associated with 'key' into 'value' and return false. In the latter case, if the types of the current value associated with 'key' and that of 'value' do not match, then 'value' is left untouched.
function.prototype: <any T1, any T2, any T3> public stateful boolean psCas(uint64 store, T1 key, mutable T2 value, T3 newValue)

function.name: psRemove
function.description: Remove an item from the given store. Returns true if the store did contain an item with the given key, false otherwise.
function.prototype: <any T1> public stateful boolean psRemove(uint64 store, T1 key)

function.name: psHas
function.description: Check if an item exists. Returns true if the given store does contain an item with the given key, false otherwise.
function.prototype: <any T1> public stateful boolean psHas(uint64 store, T1 key)

function.name: psClear
function.description: Clear the given store.
function.prototype: public stateful void psClear(uint64 store)

function.name: psSize
function.description: Get the size of the given store.
function.prototype: public stateful uint64 psSize(uint64 store)

function.name: psSerialize
function.description: Serialize all the items in the given store.
function.prototype: public stateful void psSerialize(uint64 store, mutable blob data)

function.name: psSerialize
function.description: Serialize the items in the given store that have key and value types that match those of the arguments.
function.prototype: <any T1, any T2> public stateful void psSerialize(uint64 store, mutable blob data, T1 dummyKey, T2 dummyValue)

function.name: psSerialize
function.description: Serialize the items in the given store that have key and value types that match those of the tuple argument. E.g., tuple<tuple<int32 key, rstring value> type1, tuple<list<int32> key, decimal32 value> type2>
function.prototype: <tuple T> public stateful void psSerialize(uint64 store, mutable blob data, T types)

function.name: psDeserialize
function.description: Deserialize the items from the serialized store of key and value types that match those of the arguments.
function.prototype: <any T1, any T2> public stateful void psDeserialize(uint64 store, blob data, T1 dummyKey, T2 dummyValue)

function.name: psDeserialize
function.description: Deserialize the items from the serialized store of key and value types that match those of the tuple argument. E.g., tuple<tuple<int32 key, rstring value> type1, tuple<list<int32> key, decimal32 value> type2>
function.prototype: <tuple T> public stateful void psDeserialize(uint64 store, blob data, T types)

function.name: psBeginIteration
function.description: Begin the iteration on a given store. No other operations that can modify the state can be used until after a matching psEndIteration() call. Returns the iterator.
function.prototype: public stateful uint64 psBeginIteration(uint64 store)

function.name: psGetNext
function.description: Get the next key and value of given types in the given store. Returns true if an item was found, false otherwise.
function.prototype: <any T1, any T2> public stateful boolean psGetNext(uint64 store, uint64 iterator, mutable T1 key, mutable T2 value)

function.name: psGetNext
function.description: Get the next key and value as well as their types in the given store. The values are returned (in out parameters) using their string representations no matter what their types are. Returns true if an item was found, false otherwise.
function.prototype: public stateful boolean psGetNext(uint64 store, uint64 iterator, mutable rstring key, mutable rstring value, mutable rstring keyType, mutable rstring valueType)

function.name: psEndIteration
function.description: End the iteration on the given store.
function.prototype: public stateful void psEndIteration(uint64 store, uint64 iterator)

function.name: plUnlock
function.description: Unlock the global read write lock.
function.prototype: public stateful void plUnlock()

function.name: plReadLock
function.description: Read lock the global read write lock.
function.prototype: public stateful void plReadLock()

function.name: plWriteLock
function.description: Write lock the global read write lock.
function.prototype: public stateful void plWriteLock()

function.name: plCreateLock
function.description: Create a read write lock. Return the lock handle.
function.prototype: public stateful uint64 plCreateLock()

function.name: plCreateLock
function.description: Create a read write lock. Return the lock handle if created, 0 otherwise (a process store with the same name exists).
function.prototype: public stateful uint64 plCreateLock(rstring nama)

function.name: plCreateOrGetLock
function.description: Create a read write lock or get it if it already exists.
function.prototype: public stateful uint64 plCreateOrGetLock(rstring nama)

function.name: plFindLock
function.description: Find a read write lock given its name. Return the lock handle if found, 0 otherwise.
function.prototype: public stateful uint64 plFindLock(rstring name)

function.name: plUnlock
function.description: Unlock a read write lock.
function.prototype: public stateful void plUnlock(uint64 lock)

function.name: plReadLock
function.description: Read lock a read write lock.
function.prototype: public stateful void plReadLock(uint64 lock)

function.name: plWriteLock
function.description: Write lock a read write lock.
function.prototype: public stateful void plWriteLock(uint64 lock)

function.name: plDestroy
function.description: Destroy a read write lock.
function.prototype: public stateful void plDestroy(uint64 lock)
